intro: Elaeagnus gussoni, commonly known as the golden redbud, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically 10–20 cm long and have a silvery-white underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for ornamental gardening. Elaeagnus gussoni is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, improving soil fertility.
